title: Model Namespace Reuse: An AI Supply-Chain Attack Exploiting Model Name Trust
summary: The article "Model Namespace Reuse: An AI Supply-Chain Attack Exploiting Model Name Trust" discusses a novel cybersecurity threat in the AI development landscape, where attackers exploit the trust inherent in model names within AI supply chains. By reusing model namespaces, malicious actors can introduce compromised models into AI systems, potentially leading to widespread misinformation or system disruptions. This type of attack leverages the assumption that model names are unique and credible, providing an avenue for attackers to infiltrate and manipulate AI deployments.

title: Cloudflare Blocks Record-Breaking 11.5 Tbps DDoS Attack
summary: Cloudflare successfully mitigated a record-breaking distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack that peaked at 11.5 terabits per second (Tbps). This massive attack, one of the largest ever recorded, targeted one of Cloudflare's customers but was blocked without any downtime or disruption. The attack exploited a botnet, leveraging vulnerabilities in thousands of devices connected to the internet. This incident underscores the growing scale and frequency of DDoS attacks, highlighting the critical importance of robust cybersecurity

title: CISA Adds TP-Link and WhatsApp Flaws to KEV Catalog Amid Active Exploitation
summary: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has expanded its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog by including vulnerabilities from TP-Link and WhatsApp, following reports of active exploitation. The move stresses the importance of swift action to patch these security flaws that could potentially jeopardize user privacy and system integrity. By tracking these vulnerabilities, CISA aims to alert individuals and organizations to prioritize updates and bolster their cybersecurity defenses against threats. This proactive measure is part of CISA’s ongoing efforts
